abstract: A 51-year-old woman was admitted for a painless enlargement of the thyroid lasting over 6 months. Hashimoto's thyreoiditis was diagnosed and three tumors were found: oncocytic carcinoma, malignant lymphoma and papillary carcinoma. In the right lobe, oncocytic carcinoma and high grade malignant lymphoma composed of cells with irregular, lobulated nuclei were found. The lymphoma was confined to the thyroid gland. The oncocytic carcinoma invaded the capsule and the surrounding tissues. In the left lobe, there was a papillary carcinoma.
title: [Simultaneous occurrence of papillary carcinoma, oncocytic carcinoma and malignant lymphoma of the thyroid gland in a female patient with Hashimoto's disease].
